definition: to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray

pinyin: wu4 ru4 qi2 tu2 xiao4 ying4

sentences.english: Desire. It's an emotion designed to lead us astray.
sentences.chinese: 慾望，是誘惑我們誤入歧途的情感。

sentences.english: Do you think he – or Dylan – is misguided?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲他或狄倫是步入歧途嗎？

sentences.english: The nation was led astray by a mountebank.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家被一個誇誇其談的騙子引入歧途。

sentences.english: Do you think he ? or dylan ? is misguided.
sentences.chinese: 你認爲他或狄倫是步入歧途嗎？

sentences.english: That boy is easily led away by his companions.
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩很容易被同伴引入歧途。

sentences.english: She went to Paris to bring back her errant son.
sentences.chinese: 她到巴黎去把誤入歧途的兒子領回來。

sentences.english: Young girls are easily led astray.
sentences.chinese: 年輕女子易被引入歧途。

sentences.english: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.
sentences.chinese: 法老把他的百姓領入歧途，他未將他們引入正路。

sentences.english: They may be led astray for a moment, but will soon correct themselves.
sentences.chinese: 他們也許暫時被引入歧途，但是很快就會修正其方向。

sentences.english: A lot of media attention is switching to technology in the wrong way.
sentences.chinese: 而目前媒體關注內容正將技術引入歧途。

sentences.english: After the graduation, the boy made friends with evil companions and went astray.
sentences.chinese: 畢業後，那男孩結交了壞朋友走上了歧途。

sentences.english: Too much of it may cause a man to go astray and lose himself in chimeras and illusions.
sentences.chinese: 過分隱逸使人走入歧途，迷失在狂亂幻覺中。

sentences.english: In blind error when I did persever.
sentences.chinese: 我卻盲目地一錯再錯入歧途。

sentences.english: Public opinion blames Mrs. Smith for leading the girl astray .
sentences.chinese: 輿論責怪史密斯夫人把那位姑娘引入歧途。

sentences.english: But halos also can lead investors astray.
sentences.chinese: 然而，光環也能讓投資者誤入歧途。

sentences.english: The teenage viewers are easily led astray by these commercials.
sentences.chinese: 年輕觀衆很容易被這些商業廣告引入歧途。

definition: to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
to take an indirect route/to waste one's time by using an inappropriate method
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
